Item.Description: A pair of tinted glasses.

Item.Description: A pouch for storing an important component for a spell.

Item.Name: Spellbook, Wizard's (Blank)
Item.Description: A blank wizard's spellbook for storing all of your favorite spells.

Item.Description: A slender rounded rod with tapered ends used in hand spinning to twist and wind thread from a mass of wool or flax held on a distaff.

Item.Name: Spinning Wheel
Item.Description: An apparatus for spinning yarn or thread, with a spindle driven by a wheel attached to a crank or treadle.

Item.Description: A large splint covering intended to be defensive armor for a horse.

Item.Name: Splint Barding (Medium)
Item.Description: A medium-sized splint covering intended to be defensive armor for a horse.

Item.Description: A natural 5 inch long sponge.

Item.Name: Sponge, natural (8”)
Item.Description: A natural 8 inch long sponge.

Item.Name: Spyglass
Item.Description: A small handheld telescope.

Item.Name: Standing Mirror
Item.Description: A mirror that stands upright on its own.

Item.Name: Stockings/Socks, silk
Item.Description: A pair of silk stockings/socks.

Item.Name: Stockings/Socks, wool
Item.Description: A pair of wool stockings/socks.

Item.Name: Stool, wooden (medium)
Item.Description: A medium-sized wooden stool.

Item.Name: Stool, wooden (small)
Item.Description: A small wooden stool.

Item.Name: Stout (Brew), gallon
Item.Description: A gallon of brewed Stout.

Item.Name: Studded Leather Barding (Large)
Item.Description: A large studded leather covering intended to be defensive armor for a horse.

Item.Name: Studded Leather Barding (Medium)
Item.Description: A medium-sized studded leather covering intended to be defensive armor for a horse.

Item.Name: Sugar (1 Lb)
Item.Description: A one pound bag of sugar.

Item.Name: Sugar Glider
Item.Description: A flying phalanger that feeds on wattle gum and eucalyptus sap.

Item.Name: Sundial
Item.Description: An instrument showing the time by the shadow of a pointer cast by the sun onto a plate marked with the hours of the day.

Item.Name: Sunrod
Item.Description: This 1-foot-long, gold-tipped, iron rod glows brightly when struck as a Standard Action. It sheds normal light in a 30-foot radius and increases the light level by one step for an additional 30 feet beyond that area (darkness becomes dim light and dim light becomes normal light).

Item.Name: Tablecloth, common
Item.Description: A common cloth spread over a table, especially during meals.

Item.Name: Tablecloth, fancy
Item.Description: A fancy cloth spread over a table, especially during meals.

Item.Name: Tacks (100)
Item.Description: 100 small, sharp, broad-headed nails.

Item.Name: Tanglefoot Bag
Item.Description: A tanglefoot bag is a small sack filled with tar, resin, and other sticky substances. When you throw a tanglefoot bag at a Creature, the bag comes apart and goo bursts out, entangling the target and then becoming tough and resilient upon exposure to air.

Item.Name: Tarantula
Item.Description: A large hairy spider, some kinds of which are able to catch small lizards, frogs, and birds.

Item.Name: Tavern Table
Item.Description: A table in a tavern.

Item.Name: Tea Biscuits
Item.Description: Biscuits that you eat with tea.

Item.Name: Tea Service Set
Item.Description: A set of dishes, typically of china or silver, used for serving tea.

Item.Name: Teeth (human, demihuman) per tooth
Item.Description: A collection of human/demihuman teeth sold individually.

Item.Name: Teeth (humanoid) per tooth
Item.Description: A collection of humanoid teeth sold individually.

Item.Name: Tent
Item.Description: A portable shelter made of cloth, supported by one or more poles and stretched tight by cords or loops attached to pegs driven into the ground.

Item.Name: Tent Wagon
Item.Description: A tented vehicle used for transporting goods or another specified purpose.

Item.Name: Thieves' Tools
Item.Description: A toolkit for thieves.

Item.Name: Thieves' Tools, Masterwork
Item.Description: A masterwork toolkit for thieves.

Item.Name: Thread
Item.Description: A long, thin strand of cotton, nylon, or other fibers used in sewing or weaving.

Item.Name: Thunderstone
Item.Description: You can throw this stone as a ranged attack with a range increment of 20 feet. When it strikes a hard surface (or is struck hard), it creates a deafening bang that is treated as a sonic attack.

Item.Name: Tindertwig
Item.Description: The alchemical substance on the end of this small, wooden stick ignites when struck against a rough surface. Creating a flame with a tindertwig is much faster than creating a flame with Flint and Steel (or a magnifying glass) and tinder.

Item.Name: Toffee
Item.Description: A kind of firm or hard candy that softens when sucked or chewed, made by boiling together sugar and butter, often with other ingredients or flavorings added.

Item.Name: Tombstone
Item.Description: A large, flat inscribed stone standing or laid over a grave.

Item.Name: Tool, Masterwork
Item.Description: A masterwork device or implement, especially one held in the hand, used to carry out a particular function.

Item.Name: Tooth Ointment (flask, 25 uses)
Item.Description: An Ointment for your teeth in a flask that gets 25 uses.

Item.Name: Torch
Item.Description: A portable means of illumination such as a piece of wood or cloth soaked in tallow or an oil lamp on a pole, sometimes carried ceremonially.

Item.Name: Toy Doll, common
Item.Description: A common small model of a human figure.

Item.Name: Toy Doll, fancy
Item.Description: A fancy small model of a human figure.

Item.Name: Traveler's Outfit
Item.Description: This set of clothes consists of boots, a wool skirt or breeches, a sturdy belt, a shirt (perhaps with a vest or jacket), and an ample cloak with a hood.

Item.Name: Tree (young, small)
Item.Description: A small young woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk growing to a considerable height and bearing lateral branches at some distance from the ground.

Item.Name: Truffles
Item.Description: A strong-smelling underground fungus that resembles an irregular, rough-skinned potato, growing chiefly in broadleaved woodland on calcareous soils. It is considered a culinary delicacy and found with the aid of trained dogs or pigs.

Item.Name: Turkey, domestic
Item.Description: A large domesticated game bird having a bald head and (in the male) red wattles. It is prized as food, especially on festive occasions such as Thanksgiving and Christmas.

Item.Name: Turtle
Item.Description: A slow-moving reptile, enclosed in a scaly or leathery domed shell into which it can retract its head and thick legs.

Item.Name: Vanilla Beans
Item.Description: A tropical climbing orchid that has fragrant flowers and long podlike fruit.

Item.Name: Vanity Mirror, steel
Item.Description: A steel dressing table with a mirror.

Item.Description: A common dressing table with a mirror.

Item.Name: Vanity Table (w/ mirror), fancy
Item.Description: A fancy dressing table with a mirror.

Item.Name: Vanity Table (w/ mirror), royal
Item.Description: A royal dressing table with a mirror.

Item.Name: Vase, common
Item.Description: A common everyday vase.

Item.Name: Vegetables, common
Item.Description: Some common edible vegetables.

Item.Name: Vegetables, uncommon
Item.Description: Some uncommon edible vegetables.

Item.Name: Vial, ink or potion (empty)
Item.Description: An empty vial for ink or potions.

Item.Name: Vinegar (gallon) in jar
Item.Description: A gallon of vinegar in a jar.

Item.Name: Wagon
Item.Description: A vehicle used for transporting goods or another specified purpose.

Item.Name: Warhorse, heavy
Item.Description: A heavy, powerful horse ridden in battle.

Item.Name: Warhorse, light
Item.Description: A light, powerful horse ridden in battle.

Item.Name: Warpony
Item.Description: A small, armored pony ridden in battle.

Item.Name: Warship
Item.Description: A ship equipped with weapons and designed to take part in warfare at sea.

Item.Name: Wash Basin, copper
Item.Description: A copper basin, typically fixed to a wall or on a pedestal, used for washing one's hands and face.

Item.Name: Wash Basin, wooden
Item.Description: A wooden basin, typically fixed to a wall or on a pedestal, used for washing one's hands and face.

Item.Description: A 5 gallon container, typically plastic or metal, for household refuse.

Item.Name: Waste Bin (50 gallon)
Item.Description: A 50 gallon container, typically plastic or metal, for household refuse.

Item.Name: Water Clock
Item.Description: A clock that used the flow of water to measure time.

Item.Name: Waterskin
Item.Description: A waterskin is a receptacle used to hold water.

Item.Name: Wheelbarrow
Item.Description: A small cart with a single wheel at the front and two supporting legs and two handles at the rear, used typically for carrying loads in building-work or gardening.

Item.Name: Whetstone
Item.Description: A fine-grained stone used for sharpening cutting tools.

Item.Name: Wig, common
Item.Description: A common wig for one's head.

Item.Name: Wig, fancy
Item.Description: A fancy wig for one's head.

Item.Name: Wine, Common (pitcher)
Item.Description: A pitcher of common wine.

Item.Name: Wine, Fine (bottle)
Item.Description: A bottle of fine wine.

Item.Name: Wiping Rug
Item.Description: A rug for wiping off your shoes.

Item.Name: Wood Stain (5 L)
Item.Description: A 5 liter container full of stain for a wood floor.

Item.Name: Wooden Beads (24)
Item.Description: 24 wooden beads typically rounded and perforated for threading with others as a necklace or rosary or for sewing onto fabric.

Item.Name: Wooden Mask
Item.Description: A wooden object typically worn on the face.

Item.Name: Wooden Sign, medium
Item.Description: A medium-sized wooden sign that you can place anywhere along your journey.

Item.Name: Wooden Sign, small
Item.Description: A small wooden sign that you can place anywhere along your journey.

Item.Name: Wooden Toy, common
Item.Description: A common wooden object with which a child plays.

Item.Name: Wooden Toy, fancy
Item.Description: A fancy wooden object with which a child plays.

Item.Name: Writing Board
Item.Description: A small work surface consisting of a wide, lightweight board that can be placed across the lap and used for writing.

Item.Name: Writing Quills (6)
Item.Description: 6 pens made from a main wing or tail feather of a large bird.

Item.Name: Xylophone (common)
Item.Description: A common musical instrument played by striking a row of wooden bars of graduated length with one or more small wooden or plastic mallets.

Item.Name: Xylophone (masterwork)
Item.Description: A masterwork musical instrument played by striking a row of wooden bars of graduated length with one or more small wooden or plastic mallets.

Item.Name: Yam Beer, gallon
Item.Description: A gallon jug of Yam Beer.

Item.Name: Yarn, Ball (500 ft)
Item.Description: A 500 foot long ball of spun thread.

Item.Name: Yeast (baker) (for 10 Lb)
Item.Description: A 10 pound container of a grayish-yellow preparation of yeast used by a baker to make dough.

Item.Name: Yeast (brewer) (for 10 gal)
Item.Description: A 10 gallon container of a grayish-yellow preparation of yeast used by a brewer to produce liquor.

Item.Name: Yoke (and accessories)
Item.Description: A wooden crosspiece that is fastened over the necks of two animals and attached to the plow or cart that they are to pull.
